# Typography

<Description>Adding fonts and tuning typographic details.</Description>

## Using fonts

How you choose to import and serve your fonts is up to you, Radix Themes only requires that you specify your named fonts using the correct [tokens](/themes/docs/theme/tokens#typography).

You can change the default global font family by specifying the `--default-font-family` token in your [`theme-config.css`](/themes/docs/theme/tokens#modifying-tokens).

### Self-hosted fonts

To self-host fonts, download the required font files and add them to your project. Then, use `@font-face` to define the named font weights and styles.

```css
@font-face {
  font-family: 'Inter';
  src: url('./inter-light.woff2') format('woff2');
  font-weight: 300;
  font-style: normal;
}

@font-face {
  font-family: 'Inter';
  src: url('./inter-regular.woff2') format('woff2');
  font-weight: 400;
  font-style: normal;
}

@font-face {
  font-family: 'Inter';
  src: url('./inter-medium.woff2') format('woff2');
  font-weight: 500;
  font-style: normal;
}

@font-face {
  font-family: 'Inter';
  src: url('./inter-bold.woff2') format('woff2');
  font-weight: 700;
  font-style: normal;
}
```

Then specify this named font within your [`theme-config.css`](/themes/docs/theme/tokens#modifying-tokens).

```css
.radix-themes {
  --default-font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
}
```

### With next/font

Loading fonts via [next/font](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/components/font) is supported, simply load your font with the [`variable`](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/components/font#variable) option to define a CSS variable name and assign it to `inter`. Then, use `inter.variable` to add the CSS variable to your HTML document.

```jsx
import { Inter } from 'next/font/google';

const inter = Inter({
  subsets: ['latin'],
  display: 'swap',
  variable: '--font-inter',
});

export default function RootLayout({ children }) {
  return (
    <html lang="en" className={inter.variable}>
      <body>{children}</body>
    </html>
  );
}
```

Finally, assign the CSS variable in your `themes-config.css`.

```css
.radix-themes {
  --default-font-family: var(--inter-font);
}
```

### Weight mapping

Font weight mappings are defined by the [font weight tokens](/themes/docs/theme/tokens#font-weight). Though not common, you may find your chosen typeface does not match the provided defaults. In this case, you can reassign the named weights to match those which your typeface has available inside of your `theme-config.css`:

```css
.radix-themes {
  --font-weight-light: 200;
  --font-weight-regular: 300;
  --font-weight-medium: 600;
  --font-weight-bold: 800;
}
```

### Multiple fonts

Various tokens are available for customizing fonts across different components, for example `--heading-font-family`, `--code-font-family`, `--strong-font-family` [and more](/themes/docs/theme/tokens#advanced-settings). This is helpful, for example, when you'd like to implement a font pairing for headings independently of body copy, or you wish to tune your code snippets, strong, or emphasis font assignments independently.

```css
.radix-themes {
  --default-font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
  --heading-font-family: 'Montserrat', sans-serif;
}
```

### Advanced tuning

Radix Themes has a tuned set of typographic defaults out of the box for getting the most from the default font stack. These include fine grain adjustments to letter spacing, line height, font sizing, leading trim and more.

When changing fonts it can be desirable to tweak these settings to have them compliment your chosen typeface. For example, you may find that your font has slightly different glypth dimensions and you'd like to adjust the letter spacing to compensate. In this case, you can provide different defaults to adjust these values across the entire theme.

```css
.radix-themes {
  --default-letter-spacing: 1.2;
  --default-line-height: 1.6;
  --default-leading-trim-start: 0.45em;
  --default-leading-trim-end: 0.35em;
}
```

See [tokens](/themes/docs/theme/tokens#typography) for a comprehensive list of available options.
